faqs.question: Configuring Avatar Toolkit Settings
faqs.answer:
Avatar Toolkit offers several configuration options to customize its behavior:

1) Language Settings
- Located at the top of the Settings panel
- Allows you to change the interface language
- Changes take effect after restarting Blender
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/settings/0.2.0/language.jpg[/image]

2) Armature Validation Mode
Controls how strictly Avatar Toolkit validates armatures:
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/settings/0.2.0/validation.jpg[/image]
- Strict Mode: Enforces full hierarchy checking and symmetry validation
- Basic Mode: Only checks for essential bones (hips, spine, chest, neck, head)
- None: Disables validation checks

[note]Basic Mode Warning: This mode performs limited validation and may miss important issues.[/note]
[warning]None Mode Warning: This mode disables all validation, which may lead to compatibility issues.[/warning]

3) Bone Highlighting Settings
- Enable/disable highlighting of problem bones
- When enabled, you can use the 'Highlight Problem Bones' button to visualize issues
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/settings/0.2.0/highlighting.jpg[/image]
- When disabled, you can clear existing highlighting with the 'Clear Bone Highlighting' button
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/settings/0.2.0/highlightingclear.jpg[/image]

4) Debug Settings
- Enable Logging: Activates detailed operation logging for troubleshooting
- Useful for reporting issues or understanding tool operations
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/settings/0.2.0/debug.jpg[/image]

5) Quick Access Panel Features
- Select your armature from the dropdown
- Shows validation status with detailed information:
  - Found Bones (expandable section)
  - Non-Standard Bones (expandable section)
  - Hierarchy Issues (expandable section)
  - Scale Issues (expandable section)
- T-Pose validation with detailed feedback
- Pose Mode Controls for easy armature manipulation
- Import/Export buttons for quick workflow
[image:800:800]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/settings/0.2.0/quickaccess.PNG[/image]

[note]The validation mode setting is particularly important when working with non-standard armatures. Use 'Basic' or 'None' if your armature doesn't follow typical humanoid conventions, but be aware of the limitations.[/note]

[info]Settings are automatically saved and persisted between Blender sessions.[/info]
